* **Headings hierarchy:** Use consistent heading styles (H1, H2, etc.) so assistive readers can navigate easily.  
* **Alt‑text and tagging:** If exporting to PDF, tag headings and note blocks properly so screen readers identify them. Include alternative text for any logos or images.  
* **Colour coding alternative:** If you mark annotation comments in colour, also include an italic label such as *(Safety: …)* so that it’s accessible in grayscale or to people with colour‑vision differences.  
* **Whitespace:** Leave generous margins and space between sections; avoid dense blocks, which are harder for many readers to track.
